questions.question_text: Identify three reasons for using a recovery catalog with Recovery Manager (RMAN). (Choose three.)

choices.B: to store backups that would cause the controlfile to become too large
choices.E: to store backup metadata that would cause the controlfile to become too large
choices.A: to report on the database schema at an earlier point in time
choices.D: to allow database duplication without a connection to the auxiliary instance
choices.C: to allow database duplication without a connection to the target instance

comments.content: you are correct. first of all, RMAN metadata is stored in recovery catalog and it is possible to connect to destination host without connecting to target database. connection done via auxilliary instance

discussion.content:
I think answer A, B and E. Answer C depends, because you can perform a duplication using only an auxiliairy channel by specifying clause BACKUP LOCATION. 
Doc; https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/RCMRF/rcmsynta020.htm#RCMRF126

choices.C: The recovery catalog is synchronized from the target database with a full resync at the next backup.
choices.B: The target database control file is synchronized from the recovery catalog with a partial resync at the next backup.
choices.D: The recovery catalog is synchronized from the target database with a partial resync at the next backup.
choices.A: The target database control file is synchronized from the recovery catalog with a full resync at the next backup.

questions.question_text:
You take regular backups of one of your production databases by using RMAN with a recovery catalog.
You have added two new tablespaces to this database which must be included in future backups.
Which process occurs which allows the new backups to contain the new datafiles?

comments.content: yes i agree, rman catalog do sync at target and not the other way around.

discussion.content:
Target database control file is always up-to-date. RMAN stores the information of the backup in the target database control file, and then it is pushed into the catalog once it is in place.

Adding a tablespace or adding a new datafile to a tablespace. For any action like this, the —full resynchronization— is initiated by RMAN.

Correct Answer: C

im sure this one is typo error > 9. Restore the corrupt data file.

it should be 9. Restore the data file. Not restore the corrupt file

questions.question_text:
One of your databases is in ARRCHIVELOG mode.
You back up the database by using RMAN with a recovery catalog.
One data file and all the control files are corrupt due to corruption in the storage array.
Examine this list of possible actions to recover the database:
1. Restore the control files by using the RESTORE CONTROLFILE command.
2. Mount the database.
3. Restore the data files by using the RESTORE DATABASE command.
4. Open the database with the RESETLOGS option.
5. Recover the data files by using the RECOVER USING BACKUP CONTROLFILE command.
6. Start the target database instance in NOMOUNT state.
7. Connect to the target database and the recovery catalog database instance.
8. Restore the SPFILE by using the RESTORE SPFILE command
9. Restore the corrupt data file.
10. Recover the restored data file.
Identify the minimum required steps in the correct order.

choices.C: Flashback archive FDA1 retains all data and the retention period is increased by 2 years.
choices.D: Data older than two years, if any, is purged from the flashback archive FDA1.
choices.B: Data from the first and third years is purged from the flashback archive FDA1.
choices.E: Data from the third year is purged from the flashback archive FDA1.
choices.A: An error is returned because the retention period cannot be reduced.

questions.question_text:
Flashback Data Archive has been configured to retain data on all transactions that modify a table for a period of four years.
Three years later, it is decided to change the retention period.
You execute this command:
SQL> ALTER FLASHBACK ARCHIVE fda1 MODIFY RETENSION RETENTION 2 YEAR;
Which is true?

choices.E: Object statistics in the data dictionary
choices.D: Type of connection used to connect to database instance

questions.question_text: Which three factors influences the optimizer's choice of an execution plan? (Choose three.)
